description: Late Middle English finial < Old French fin or Latin fīnis (“end”)  +‎ -ial

entries.meaning: (architecture) The knot or bunch of foliage, or foliated ornament, that forms the upper extremity of a pinnacle in Gothic architecture.
(by extension) Any decorative fitting at the peak of a gable, or on the top of a flagpole, fencepost, newel post of a staircase etc.
